review: I bought 3 of these, 1 for each child.  The fire sticks continuously lost the WiFi signal and locked up constantly - even with a very strong signal in the house that all other devices do not have any problems with. Some food for thought - I figured these would be a good alternative instead of having to rent 3 individual DTAs from my cable provider (due to the digital conversion) at $2 / per DTA and give the kids Fire sticks so they can stream movies. Turns out, all they really could use was Netflix because all the other apps require a participating cable provider, which Brighthouse was not. Then Netflix limits the basic plan to two streams, so I would need to pay an additional 4$ - for two more streams. All that aside - it was more cost effective to just get the DTAs. They can use their tablets and computers for streaming Netflix - if they really want it that badly.

review: For some reason the device refuses to let me change the audio defaults meaning that I have to change every source from 5.1 to simple stereo. In addition, some small number of Amazon Prime videos do not allow me to make that change making the film a silent movie. Finally, while my Cromecaster works 80% of the time, this device loses WiFi connectivity at least twice as often...That said, when it works, it works great.
